item.title: S.H.E.L.L CTF
item.author: Author
item.description: This past weekend I decided to play around in the SHELL CTF in between working on my capstone project. Didn’t have a ton of time but wanted to knock out some forensics challenges. Unfortunately, for whatever reason, forensics in this CTF was more stegonography challenges than anything else. Still fun though. Challenges

item.title: HeroCTF 2021
item.author: Author
item.description: Not much of a break from the Hack the Box CTF. HeroCTF was pretty fun. Didn’t have much time to poke at the challenges due to the multiple DDOS attacks on their servers over the weekend but from what I’ve seen the organizers did a good job. Challenge Write-ups

item.title: HeroCTF 2021 - Challenges
item.author: Author
item.description: OSINT Find Me Reverse image search the given file. One of the websites states that it is the Portes Mordelaises. Social ID #1 Head over to https://tweeterid.com and just put in the HeroCTF handle. Social ID #2 Head over to https://tweeterid.com again and just put in the ID instead. Transfer Look up the bitcoin transaction ID and find the wallet the transaction went to. ProtonDate Look up the email from within Proton Mail and it will show you when the RSA key was created.

item.title: Cyber Apocalypse 2021 - Challenges
item.author: Author
item.description: AlienPhish Unzip the downloadable file and view the slide1.xml.rels file. Inside is a command with some of the text backwards. Flip the text and decode the base64 for the flag. Authenticator Open the downloadable file with Ghidra and look through the functions. In the check pin function is a string with a ^9. Take the string to CyberChef and XOR with a key of 9 to get the flag. BlitzProp View the website and intecept the traffic with Burp.

item.title: Cyber Apocalypse 2021
item.author: Author
item.description: This week our Cybersecurity Club took part in Hack the Box’s Cyber Apocalypse 2021 CTF. WGU Fowl Owls ended up placing 195/4740 teams. Below are the links to the write-ups for the individual challenges. Challenges

item.title: HackPack CTF 2021
item.author: Author
item.description: This weekend was the HackPack CTF for 2021. It turns out the time I set aside on Satuday didn’t amount too much since the CTF was from 1100EST Friday to 1100EST Saturday. The challenges I looked through were pretty fun and I was only able to complete a few in the time I had. Challenge Write-ups
